result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Peter Tempelis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Thomas W Jacobs.  
Defendant Thomas W Jacobs in court, in custody. 
Attorney Hughes requests that the case be set for plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

8:28 AM Defendant Thomas W Jacobs in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Thomas W Jacobs.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:21 AM Defendant Thomas W Jacobs not in court, in custody at the Waukesha County Jail.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Thomas W Jacobs.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
This matter was set for a waiver of preliminary hearing and the Court was notified the defendant has refused to come to Court today.  The Preliminary hearing was requested within 10 days but the Court finds good cause to toll the time limits for preliminary hearing and will adjourn to next week.  The Court orders the defendant be produced at the next date and will authorize the use of force if defendant refuses.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.   Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

2:54 PM Defendant Thomas W Jacobs in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Thomas W Jacobs. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Maruffo. 
Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Steven Hughes will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS. Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas W Jacobs
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-10-2022)

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.

2:32 PM Defendant Thomas William Jacobs in court, in custody. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Public Defenders Office to re-evaluate the defendant prior to the next date.
